itemDescription: Scottish recipient of the Victoria Cross

wikipedia_page.main: William Gardner VC DCM (3 March 1821 – 24 October 1897) was a Scottish recipient of the Victoria Cross, the highest and most prestigious award for gallantry in the face of the enemy that can be awarded to British and Commonwealth forces.

response: * William Gardner, Indian Mutiny Bareilly, 5 May 1858

link_mentions.page: List of Scottish Victoria Cross recipients
